law.catch_line: Private security guards; wearing of certain uniforms prohibited.

text.section:
Sec. 8A-152. Private security guards; wearing of certain uniforms prohibited.
After June 1, 1971, it shall be unlawful for any employee of any private security agency to wear any badge, uniform, or insignia of such similarity of design, color or inscription to the official badge, uniform, or insignia of the Miami-Dade Police Department or of any municipal police department of the County which is indistinguishable therefrom at a distance of twenty (20) feet.
